meanings.definition: A group of people sharing a common profession or interests.
meanings.sent1: In our neighborhood, the gardening fraternities meet every Saturday to exchange tips and tricks.
meanings.sent2: The fraternities of bird watchers often go on field trips together to observe different species.
meanings.sent3: The fraternities of stamp collectors had a heated debate over the rarest stamp in the world.
meanings.sent4: The fraternities of book lovers formed an alliance to share their favorite reads with each other.
meanings.sent5: Joining the fraternities of artists opened up a whole new world of creativity and inspiration.

meanings.definition: The state or feeling of friendship and mutual support within a group.
meanings.sent1: The fraternities among the hikers grew stronger as they faced challenges together on the trail.
meanings.sent2: There was a sense of genuine fraternities among the volunteers working at the local shelter.
meanings.sent3: The fraternities among the team members made the workplace a more enjoyable and productive environment.
meanings.sent4: The fraternities within the community helped each other rebuild after the devastating storm.
meanings.sent5: The fraternities within the orchestra created a harmonious atmosphere during rehearsals.

meanings.definition: An organization of male students at a college or university.
meanings.sent1: The fraternities on campus often host social events and fundraisers for various causes.
meanings.sent2: Joining a fraternity can provide male students with a sense of belonging and camaraderie.
meanings.sent3: The fraternities at the university competed in a friendly sports tournament against the sororities.
meanings.sent4: Being part of a fraternity can offer male students a network of support and friendship.
meanings.sent5: The fraternities at the college campus have a long-standing tradition of community service.
